text.section: An issuer that is liable for wrongful registration of transfer under subsection (1) of this section on demand shall provide the person entitled to the security with a like certificated or uncertificated security, and any payments or distributions that the person did not receive as a result of the wrongful registration. If an overissue would result, the issuer's liability to provide the person with a like security is governed by KRS 355.8-210.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection (1) of this section or in a law relating to the collection of taxes, an issuer is not liable to an owner or other person suffering loss as a result of the registration of a transfer of a security if registration was made pursuant to an effective indorsement or instruction.

law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 150, effective January 1, 1997. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 118, sec. 49, effective July 1, 1987. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 8-404, effective July 1, 1960.
